Wrangle Household Survey 1 Introduction
Wrangle Household Survey 2025-10-07 1 Introduction This document cleans and wrangles data from the household survey.
import-household-survey-data.html
2 Import household survey data 2.1 Load household survey dataset 2.2 Save into R format

2 Import household survey data Note: change in protocol Aug 4th for Malawi, and around Aug 6th for Uganda. Code packages <- c( "tidyverse", "here", "haven", "skimr", "kableExtra", "haven", "janitor" ) pacman::p_load( packages, character.only = TRUE ) 2.1 Load household survey dataset Code hh_raw_ug <- read_dta( file.path( path_box, "DATA - SHARED WITH IPA", "Uganda", "02_Baseline", "03_Data Cleaning", "3_post_hfc_data", "3_HH Survey", "DIL Household Survey_checked.dta" ) ) %>% haven::as_factor(levels = "labels") %>% mutate( size_ot = as.character(size_ot) ) %>% remove_empty %>% select( -contains("hr") ) ## value for "which" not specified, defaulting to c("rows", "cols") Code hh_raw_ug_ilc <- read_dta( file.path( path_box, "DATA - SHARED WITH IPA", "Uganda", "02_Baseline", "03_Data Cleaning", "3_post_hfc_data", "3_HH Survey", "DIL Household Survey_V3_checked.dta" ) ) %>% haven::as_factor(levels = "labels") %>% mutate( size_ot = as.character(size_ot) ) %>% remove_empty %>% select( -contains("hr") ) ## value for "which" not specified, defaulting to c("rows", "cols") Code hh_raw_mw <- read_dta( file.path( path_box, "DATA - SHARED WITH IPA", "Malawi", "02_Baseline", "03_Data Cleaning", "3_post_hfc_data", "3_household_survey", "DIL_Household_checked_Malawi.dta" ) ) %>% haven::as_factor(levels = "labels") %>% remove_empty() %>% select( -contains("hr") ) %>% mutate( across( c(int_promoter, int_warned), ~ case_when( . == 0 ~ "No", . == 1 ~ "Yes" ) ), int_promoter_last = case_when( int_promoter == 1 ~ "In the past 30 days", int_promoter == 2 ~ "In the past 6 months", int_promoter == 3 ~ "In the past year", int_promoter == 4 ~ "It's been more than a year", int_promoter == -999 ~ "Don't know" ), int_warned_who = case_when( int_warned_who == 1 ~ "The promoter", int_warned_who == 2 ~ "Someone from outside the village", int_warned_who == 3 ~ "A neighbor", int_warned_who == -666 ~ "Other" ) ) ## value for "which" not specified, defaulting to c("rows", "cols") Code hh_raw <- hh_raw_mw %>% bind_rows(hh_raw_ug) %>% bind_rows(hh_raw_ug_ilc) 2.2 Save into R format Code path <- file.path( "Data", "HouseholdSurvey", "DataSets", "Raw", "hh-survey" ) hh_raw %>% write_meta( path_data = file.path(path_box, path), path_meta = file.path(path_git, 3 Clean Household Survey (clean-survey) 3.1 Check unique ID 3.2 Corrections 3.3 Replace missing codes 3.4 Replace NAs from skip patterns 3.5 Clean text variables 3.6 Clean date of survey 3.7 Turn dummy vairables into logical 3.8 Merge variables 3.9 Drop surveycto coding variables 3.10 Combine household_id and household_id_pl 3.11 Export data

3 Clean Household Survey (clean-survey) Code packages <- c( "tidyverse", "here", "haven", "skimr", "janitor", "assertthat", "str2str" ) pacman::p_load( packages, character.only = TRUE ) Code hh_raw <- read_rds( file.path( path_box, "Data", "HouseholdSurvey", "DataSets", "Raw", "hh-survey.rds" ) ) 3.1 Check unique ID Code hh_unique <- hh_raw %>% mutate( household_id = coalesce(household_id, household_id_pl) ) We check the uniqueness of the household ID variable, since the enumerators should only submit the form once the household will no longer be visited again. Code assert_that( n_distinct(hh_raw$household_id_pl) == nrow(hh_raw) ) Some duplicate entries are coming from non-responses Code hh_unique %>% group_by(household_id, survey_type) %>% dplyr::filter(n() > 1) %>% select( key, household_id_pl, enumerator_id, village_id_pl, submissiondate, starttime, full_names_pl, visit_landmarks_pl, respo_availability, consent, duration, complete, comment ) %>% arrange(household_id_pl) %>% view hh_unique %>% group_by(country_pl, household_id_pl) %>% dplyr::filter(n() > 1, household_id_pl != "ZOU8362510MW2") %>% summarise( message = paste("Duplicate entries:", paste(key, collapse = ", ")) ) %>% view Code hh_unique %>% tabyl(respo_availability, consent) ## respo_availability No Yes NA_ ## No 0 0 33 ## Yes 1 4807 8 People with missing consent turned out not to be using the water point described Code hh_unique %>% dplyr::filter(respo_availability == "Yes", is.na(consent)) %>% view Code hh_consented <- hh_unique %>% dplyr::filter(consent == "Yes" & !is.na(consent)) These Code hh_consented <- hh_consented %>% group_by(household_id, survey_type) %>% dplyr::filter( !((n() > 1) & (starttime == min(starttime))) ) %>% ungroup Code assert_that( hh_consented %>% select(household_id, survey_type) %>% unique %>% nrow == nrow(hh_consented) ) ## [1] TRUE 3.2 Corrections Code hh_corrected <- hh_consented %>% mutate( across( village_id_pl, ~ case_when( . == "1050304002" ~ "1050702004", TRUE ~ . ) ) ) 3.3 Replace missing codes Some of the “don’t know” and “unsure” values in the survey are coded differently, so we standardize them to 9999. -666 corresponds to “other,” but we deal with this later. Code hh_clean <- hh_corrected %>% mutate( across( where(is.character) & !where(is.factor), ~ . %>% str_replace_all("[.]", "") %>% na_if("") %>% na_if("-999") %>% na_if("9999") ), across( where(is.numeric), ~ na_if(., -999) %>% na_if(9999) ), across( contains("timestamp"), as.numeric ) ) 3.4 Replace NAs from skip patterns Code hh_clean <- hh_clean %>% mutate( across( make_watersafe_1:make_watersafe_8, ~ case_when( do_anything == "No" ~ 0, TRUE ~ . ) ) ) 3.5 Clean text variables Code hh_clean <- hh_clean %>% mutate( across( c(ends_with("_pl"), matches("name"), matches("comment")), ~ . %>% str_squish %>% str_to_upper ), across( where(is.character), ~ ifelse(grepl("HTTP|photo|uuid|size_ot", .x), str_to_lower(.x), .x) ) ) 3.6 Clean date of survey We have SubmissionDate, starttime, and endtime. We will use “submissiondate” for the date. Code hh_clean <- hh_clean %>% mutate(date = as.Date(substr(submissiondate, 1, 10))) Code hh_clean %>% tabyl(date, country_pl) ## date MALAWI UGANDA ## 2025-07-04 0 12 ## 2025-07-07 0 12 ## 2025-07-09 0 30 ## 2025-07-10 0 61 ## 2025-07-11 0 57 ## 2025-07-14 0 22 ## 2025-07-15 0 14 ## 2025-07-16 0 87 ## 2025-07-17 0 3 ## 2025-07-18 4 75 ## 2025-07-19 146 5 ## 2025-07-21 126 43 ## 2025-07-22 67 49 ## 2025-07-23 29 94 ## 2025-07-24 114 1 ## 2025-07-25 132 79 ## 2025-07-26 112 27 ## 2025-07-27 7 0 ## 2025-07-28 42 67 ## 2025-07-29 85 78 ## 2025-07-30 139 51 ## 2025-07-31 123 58 ## 2025-08-01 91 67 ## 2025-08-02 117 0 ## 2025-08-03 4 0 ## 2025-08-04 169 68 ## 2025-08-05 87 59 ## 2025-08-06 115 18 ## 2025-08-07 70 87 ## 2025-08-08 63 95 ## 2025-08-09 61 0 ## 2025-08-10 5 0 ## 2025-08-11 97 48 ## 2025-08-12 60 41 ## 2025-08-13 63 26 ## 2025-08-14 81 0 ## 2025-08-15 79 54 ## 2025-08-16 59 34 ## 2025-08-17 5 24 ## 2025-08-18 143 15 ## 2025-08-19 150 59 ## 2025-08-20 32 45 ## 2025-08-21 0 4 ## 2025-08-26 20 0 ## 2025-08-27 12 0 ## 2025-09-16 0 34 ## 2025-09-17 0 94 ## 2025-09-18 0 61 ## 2025-09-19 0 4 ## 2025-09-22 0 5 ## 2025-09-23 0 15 ## 2025-09-24 0 38 ## 2025-09-25 0 55 ## 2025-09-26 0 63 ## 2025-09-27 0 2 ## 2025-09-29 0 12 ## 2025-09-30 0 45 3.7 Turn dummy vairables into logical Code hh_clean <- hh_clean %>% mutate( across( where(~ all(unique(.) %in% c(0, 1, NA))), ~ as.logical(.) ), across( where(is_dummy), ~ (. == "Yes") ), across( where(~ (is.factor(.) | is.character(.)) & all(levels(.) %in% c("Don’t Know", "Don’t Know", "Don't know", "No", "Yes", NA))), ~ case_when( . == "Yes" ~ TRUE, . == "No" ~ FALSE ), .names = "{.col}_c" ) ) 3.8 Merge variables The questions related to characteristics of the household head were not asked if the respondent herself was the household head. Code hh_clean <- hh_clean %>% mutate( hhh_educ_ug_c = if_else(relation == "Me/respondent is the HoH", educ, hh_educ), hhh_educ_mw_c = if_else(relation == "Me/respondent is the HoH", educ_mw, hh_educ), hhh_gender_c = if_else(relation == "Me/respondent is the HoH", sex, gender_hhh), hhh_age_c = if_else(relation == "Me/respondent is the HoH", age_resp, hhh_age), educ = case_when( # Uganda educ %in% c("Never attended school / did not complete class", "Informal Training") ~ "None", educ %in% c("Pre-primary", "P1", "P2", "P3", "P4", "P5", "P6") ~ "Pre-primary", educ %in% c("P7", "PLE", "S1", "S2", "S3") ~ "Primary", educ %in% c("S4", "O level", "S5", "S6", "A level", "Polytechnic") ~ "Secondary", educ %in% c("College (non-University)", "University") ~ "Post-secondary", # Malawi educ_mw == "No formal education / Never attended school" ~ "None", educ_mw == "Some Primary School (Did not complete Standard 8)" ~ "Pre-primary", educ_mw %in% c("Primary School Leaving Certificate (PSLCE) (Completed Standard 8)", "Junior Certificate of Education (JCE) (Completed Form 2)") ~ "Primary", educ_mw %in% c("Malawi School Certificate of Education (MSCE) (Completed Form 4)", "Vocational/Technical Training (e.g., TEVETA certification)") ~ "Secondary", educ_mw %in% c("Diploma (e.g., teaching, nursing, other post-secondary diploma)", "Bachelor's Degree") ~ "Post-secondary" ) ) 3.9 Drop surveycto coding variables Code hh_clean <- hh_clean %>% dplyr::select( -c( hh_randtxt, hh_randnum, hh_randnum_int, vil_id ), -matches("index") ) 3.10 Combine household_id and household_id_pl Code hh_clean <- hh_clean %>% mutate( household_id = coalesce(household_id, household_id_pl) ) %>% select(-household_id_pl) 3.11 Export data Code path <- file.path( "Data", "HouseholdSurvey", "DataSets", "Clean", "hh-survey-clean" ) write_meta( hh_clean, path_data = file.path(path_box, path), path_meta = file.path(path_git, path) ) Table 3.1: Data summary Name Piped data 4 Construct household location 4.1 Create spatial version of the data set 4.2 Save data

4 Construct household location Code packages <- c( "tidyverse", "sf", "skimr", "janitor", "haven", "viridis", "leaflet", "randomcoloR" ) pacman::p_load(packages, character.only = TRUE) Code hh_clean <- read_rds( here( path_box, "Data", "HouseholdSurvey", "DataSets", "Clean", "hh-survey-clean.rds" ) ) 4.1 Create spatial version of the data set We choose to project the coordinates to the EPSG code 4326, which adds Greenwich as the starting point (prime meridian) for the longitude and sets the units to degrees. Note that the spatial datasets include only households who gave consent for their GPS coordinates to be recorded. Code hh_sf <- hh_clean %>% dplyr::filter(!is.na(gpslongitude) & !is.na(gpslatitude)) %>% select(key, starts_with("gps")) %>% st_as_sf( coords = c("gpslongitude", "gpslatitude"), crs = 4326 ) 4.2 Save data Code path <- file.path( "Data", "HouseholdSurvey", "DataSets", "Spatial", "hh-gps" ) hh_sf %>% write_meta( path_data = file.path(path_box, path), path_meta = file.path(path_git, path) ) ## Warning: Couldn't find skimmers for class: sfc_POINT, sfc; No user-defined ## `sfl` provided. 5 Construct chlorine testing variables (construct-chlorine-tests) 5.1 Load data 5.2 Create final chlorine variables 5.3 Export data

5 Construct chlorine testing variables (construct-chlorine-tests) Code packages <- c( "tidyverse", "janitor", "sf" ) pacman::p_load(packages, character.only = TRUE) 5.1 Load data Code hh <- read_rds( file.path( path_box, "Data", "HouseholdSurvey", "DataSets", "Clean", "hh-survey-clean.rds" ) ) 5.1.1 Manual corrections Observations with E-15 and very dark pink color: chlorine residual is too high for the colorimeter to read. We’re assigning a high-value, which doesn’t mean that’s the exact reading. Code error15_fcr <- c( "uuid:186780bf-c04f-4d10-a293-bb7fbb670cbb", "uuid:8bd53cc5-7bd7-4682-834d-2999b6d27da4" ) error15_tcr <- c( "uuid:186780bf-c04f-4d10-a293-bb7fbb670cbb", "uuid:4be915eb-a15d-48a0-bbfb-73fb65349e21" ) hh <- hh %>% mutate( meterfcr_c = case_when( key %in% error15_fcr ~ 2.4, TRUE ~ meterfcr ), metertcr_c = case_when( key %in% error15_tcr ~ 2.4, TRUE ~ metertcr ) ) 5.2 Create final chlorine variables Code hh <- hh %>% mutate( discfcr_c = discfcr, disctcr_c = disctcr ) %>% mutate( across( ends_with("cr_c"), ~ . >= 0.1, .names = "{.col}_01" ), across( ends_with("cr_c"), ~ . >= 0.2, .names = "{.col}_02" ) ) %>% select( key, household_id, matches("tcr"), matches("fcr"), -where(~(levels(.) %>% n_distinct()) == 1) ) 5.3 Export data Code path <- file.path( "Data", "HouseholdSurvey", "DataSets", "Constructed", "hh-survey-chlorine" ) write_meta( hh, path_data = file.path(path_box, path), path_meta = file.path(path_git, path) ) Table 5.1: Data construct-data-quality-flags-construct-sensitivity-flags.html

6 Construct data quality flags (construct-sensitivity-flags) 6.1 Load data 6.2 Flag if data is marked on the issues log as low-quality 6.3 Flag if there was Evidence Action/promoter interference 6.4 Flag if the village had a low proportion of water come from the primary source 6.5 Export data

6 Construct data quality flags (construct-sensitivity-flags) Code packages <- c( "tidyverse", "here", "haven", "skimr", "janitor", "googlesheets4" ) pacman::p_load( packages, character.only = TRUE ) 6.1 Load data Code hh <- read_rds( file.path( path_box, "Data", "HouseholdSurvey", "DataSets", "Clean", "hh-survey-clean.rds" ) ) gsheet <- gs4_get("https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1wLCxkLwPlxcfOH14ziLS5s4pqCHf2k4NaBYckLqUYew/edit?usp=sharing") ## ! Using an auto-discovered, ## cached token. ## To suppress this message, ## modify your code or options ## to clearly consent to the ## use of a cached token. ## See gargle's ## "Non-interactive auth" ## vignette for more details: ## <https://gargle.r-lib.org/articles/non-interactive-auth.html> ## ℹ The googlesheets4 package ## is using a cached token for ## 'luizaandrade@uchicago.edu'. ## Auto-refreshing stale OAuth token. Code gsheet_id <- gsheet$spreadsheet_id 6.2 Flag if data is marked on the issues log as low-quality Code flags_ug <- read_sheet( ss = gsheet, sheet = "Uganda Household Survey" ) %>% mutate( across( everything(), as.character ), sheet_row = row_number() + 1L ) ## ✔ Reading from ## "HFCs Issues Log". ## ✔ Range ## ''Uganda Household Survey''. Code flags_mw <- read_sheet( ss = gsheet, sheet = "Malawi Household Survey" ) %>% mutate( across( everything(), as.character ), sheet_row = row_number() + 1L ) ## ✔ Reading from ## "HFCs Issues Log". ## ✔ Range ## ''Malawi Household Survey''. Code flags <- bind_rows( flags_ug, flags_mw ) %>% mutate( `data team comments` = str_to_lower(`data team comments`) ) low_quality_ids <- flags %>% dplyr::filter( str_detect( `data team comments`, "low-quality") | str_detect(`data team comments`, "low quality") ) %>% pull(household_id) hh <- hh %>% mutate( flag_low_quality = !is.na(household_id) & (household_id %in% low_quality_ids) ) 6.3 Flag if there was Evidence Action/promoter interference Code interference_vil_ids <- c( ### Uganda "1070401003", # Buloke "1101109006", # Saaka B "1101308001", # Bukunya "1050103005", # Buwenge Bunawale "1050901001", # Kaiti Kaiti ### Malawi "2030309037", # Mataka 2 "2041608019", # Saidi Mataka "2030901003", # Likhomo ### Household respondents reported being warned "1130904002", "1101309001", "1020306002", "1130904002", "1101309001", "1160604001", "1190401001", "1130904002", "1190401001", "1090403006", "1130904002", "2020708036", "2020317075", "2030106036" ) hh <- hh %>% mutate( flag_interference = !is.na(village_id_pl) & (village_id_pl %in% interference_vil_ids) ) 6.4 Flag if the village had a low proportion of water come from the primary source Code low_primary_collection_vil_ids <- c( "" ) hh <- hh %>% mutate( flag_low_primary_collection = !is.na(village_id_pl) & (village_id_pl %in% low_primary_collection_vil_ids) ) %>% select( household_id, contains("flag") ) 6.5 Export data Code path <- file.path( "Data", "HouseholdSurvey", "DataSets", "Constructed", "hh-survey-constructed" ) write_meta( hh, path_data = file.path(path_box, path), path_meta = file.path(path_git, path) ) Table 6.1: Data summary Name Piped data Number of rows 4806 Number of columns 4 _______________________ Column type frequency: character 1 logical 3 ________________________ Group variables None Variable type: character skim_variable n_missing complete_rate min max empty n_unique whitespace household_id 0 1 10 13 0 4778 0 Variable type: logical skim_variable n_missing complete_rate mean count flag_low_quality 0 1 0.01 FAL: 4740, TRU: 66 flag_interference 0 1 0.09 FAL: 4350, TRU: 456 flag_low_primary_collection 0 1 0.00 FAL: 4806
combine-with-water-point-data.html
7 Combine with water point data 7.1 Load data 7.2 Check water point ID presence

7 Combine with water point data Code pacman::p_load( tidyverse, janitor ) 7.1 Load data Code hh_clean <- read_rds( here( path_box, "Data", "HouseholdSurvey", "DataSets", "Clean", "hh-survey-clean.rds" ) ) 7.2 Check water point ID presence Code hh_clean %>% dplyr::filter(is.na(wp_id_pl)) %>% tabyl(survey_type) ## survey_type n percent ## Household Survey (HH Census Respondents) 331 0.7164502 ## Monitoring Survey (Promoter Respondents) 131 0.2835498 The water point ID should never be missing for household survey households Code hh_clean %>% dplyr::filter(is.na(wp_id_pl) & is.na(wp_id_coa)) %>% select(contains("pl")) %>% view Code hh_census <- read_rds( file.path( path_box, "Data", "HouseholdCensus", "DataSets", "Constructed", "hh-census-constructed.rds" ) ) Code hh_census %>% dplyr::filter( consent, household_id %in% (hh_clean %>% dplyr::filter(str_detect(survey_type, "Household")) %>% pull(household_id)), is.na(wp_id_c) ) %>% select(village_id, wp_name, wp_name_coa) %>% unique %>% view
create-final-household-survey-data.html
8 Create final household survey data 8.1 Load data 8.2 Combine data 8.3 Select final variables 8.4 Export data

8 Create final household survey data Code packages <- c( "tidyverse", "here", "haven", "skimr", "kableExtra", "assertthat", "janitor", "sf" ) pacman::p_load( packages, character.only = TRUE ) 8.1 Load data 8.1.1 Household survey Code hh_survey <- read_rds( file.path( path_box, "Data", "HouseholdSurvey", "DataSets", "Clean", "hh-survey-clean.rds" ) ) %>% mutate(village_id = village_id_pl) 8.1.2 Chlorine testing Code tests <- read_rds( file.path( path_box, "Data", "HouseholdSurvey", "DataSets", "Constructed", "hh-survey-chlorine.rds" ) ) %>% select( key, disctcr_c, disctcr_color, disctcr_c_02, discfcr_c, discfcr_color, discfcr_c_02, metertcr_c, metertcr_color, metertcr_c_02, metertcr_c_01, meterfcr_c, meterfcr_color, meterfcr_c_02, meterfcr_c_01, ) 8.1.3 GPS Code gps <- read_rds( file.path( path_box, "Data", "HouseholdSurvey", "DataSets", "Spatial", "hh-gps.rds" ) ) 8.1.4 Promoter census Code pm_survey <- read_rds( file.path( path_box, "Data", "PromoterSurvey", "DataSets", "Final", "pm-survey.rds" ) ) %>% select(wp_id) %>% unique %>% mutate(promoter_wp = TRUE) 8.1.5 Household census Code hh_census <- read_rds( file.path( path_box, "Data", "HouseholdCensus", "DataSets", "Constructed", "hh-census-constructed.rds" ) ) villages <- hh_census %>% select( country, district_id, district, village, village_id, sample_group, sample, ea_program_vil, vil_rain, potential_interference, ilc_cluster_id, vil_replaced ) %>% unique hh_census <- hh_census %>% select( household_id, wp_id = wp_id_c, wp_sec_notworking:vil_ilc_selfreport, hh_dsw:wp_disctcr_un_02, hhh_educ, hhh_gender, hhh_age_hhc = hhh_age, hh_hhsincompound, hh_members, hh_adults, hh_males, hh_females, hh_pregnant, hh_under5, hh_under2 ) 8.2 Combine data We previously calculated the distances from households to various water points in the household census processing scripts. We merge this data to the household survey data by household ID, then only select analysis variables for the final dataset. 8.2.1 Chlorine tests Code assert_that( all(tests$key %in% hh_survey$key) ) ## [1] TRUE Code hh_survey_joined <- hh_survey %>% left_join(tests, relationship = "one-to-one") ## Joining with `by = ## join_by(discfcr_color, ## disctcr_color, ## meterfcr_color, ## metertcr_color, key)` 8.2.2 Household census Code assert_that( all(hh_survey$household_id %in% hh_census$household_id) ) hh_survey %>% dplyr::filter(!(household_id %in% hh_census$household_id)) %>% view Code hh_survey_joined <- hh_survey_joined %>% rename( wp_dsw_selfreport = wp_dsw_c, wp_ilc_selfreport = wp_ilc_c ) %>% select(-c(wp_dsw, wp_ilc)) %>% inner_join(hh_census, relationship = "many-to-one") ## Joining with `by = ## join_by(household_id)` 8.3 Select final variables 8.3.1 ID variables Code ids <- hh_survey_joined %>% select( key, household_id, village_id ) %>% left_join(villages) ## Joining with `by = ## join_by(village_id)` 8.3.2 Meta data Code meta <- hh_survey_joined %>% transmute( key, date, hhs = TRUE, survey = survey_type %>% fct_recode( "Household Survey" = "Household Survey (HH Census Respondents)", "Monitoring Survey" = "Monitoring Survey (Promoter Respondents)" ) ) 8.3.3 Household characteristics Code household <- hh_survey_joined %>% rename( resp_age = age_resp, resp_sex = sex, resp_hhh = relation ) %>% mutate( hhh_gender = coalesce(hhh_gender_c, hhh_gender), resp_educ = case_when( # Uganda educ %in% c("Never attended school / did not complete class", "Informal Training") ~ "None", educ %in% c("Pre-primary", "P1", "P2", "P3", "P4", "P5", "P6") ~ "Pre-primary", educ %in% c("P7", "PLE", "S1", "S2", "S3") ~ "Primary", educ %in% c("S4", "O level", "S5", "S6", "A level", "Polytechnic") ~ "Secondary", educ %in% c("College (non-University)", "University") ~ "Post-secondary", # Malawi educ_mw == "No formal education / Never attended school" ~ "None", educ_mw == wpuse_whynot = notuse, wpuse_whynot_o = notuse_ot, wp_more_c, wp_count_pastmonth, wp_intervention_type ) 8.3.5 Water sample Code water <- hh_survey_joined %>% mutate(water_sample = coalesce(glass_water, give_water)) %>% select( key, wp_id, prepare_water = prepare_water_c, starts_with("prep_different_"), water_sample, notgivewater, notgivewater_ot, storage, other_cont, other_plastic, access_contain, access_contain_ot, cover_storage, cover_storage_ot, howlong_waterprep, who_collected, who_collected_ot, age_child, size, size_ot, watertreat_any = do_anything_c, -matches("make_watersafe(*)_c"), -matches("prep_different(*)_c") ) 8.3.6 Water treatment Code water_treatment <- hh_survey_joined %>% select( key, contains("everdo_"), contains("reason_notchlorinate_"), often_chlorinate ) 8.3.7 Data quality flags Code flags <- hh_survey_joined %>% select( key, starts_with("flag_") ) 8.3.8 Combine all Code final <- ids %>% left_join(villages) %>% left_join(meta) %>% left_join(household) %>% left_join(wp) %>% left_join(water) %>% left_join(water_treatment) %>% left_join(tests) %>% left_join(pm_survey) %>% 9 Create final household survey data Code pacman::p_load( tidyverse, here, haven, skimr, kableExtra, assertthat, sf ) 9.1 Load data Code hh_survey <- read_rds( file.path( path_box, "Data", "HouseholdSurvey", "DataSets", "Final", "hh-survey.rds" ) ) 9.2 Change format Code vars <- hh_survey %>% select( household_id, country, sample_group, wp_intervention_type, watertreat_any, contains("make_watersafe"), contains("everdo_") ) %>% select(-make_watersafe_ot) %>% pivot_longer( cols = contains("make_watersafe"), names_pattern = "make_watersafe_(.*)", values_to = "adopted" ) %>% mutate( adopted = adopted %>% replace_na(FALSE), method = case_when( name == "1" ~ "Boil", name == "2" ~ "Chlorine from dispenser", name == "3" ~ "Chlorine from other source", name == "4" ~ "Strain through a cloth", name == "5" ~ "Use water filter", name == "6" ~ "Sand/composite", name == "7" ~ "Solar disinfection", name == "8" ~ "Let it stand and settle", name == "_666" ~ "Other", name == "_999" ~ "Don't know" ) ) %>% dplyr::filter(!is.na(method)) %>% select(-name) Code vars <- hh_survey %>% select( household_id, country, sample_group, wp_intervention_type, contains("everdo_"), -c(contains("label"), everdo_list_count, contains("method"), everdo_ot, everdo_concat) ) %>% pivot_longer( cols = contains("everdo_"), names_pattern = "everdo_(.*)", values_to = "adopted" ) %>% mutate( adopted = adopted %>% replace_na(FALSE), method = case_when( name == "0" ~ "No treatment", name == "22" ~ "None (water is alredy treated)", name == "1" ~ "Boil", name == "2" ~ "Chlorine from dispenser", name == "3" ~ "Chlorine from other source", name == "4" ~ "Strain through a cloth", name == "5" ~ "Use water filter", name == "6" ~ "Sand/composite", name == "7" ~ "Solar disinfection", name == "8" ~ "Let it stand and settle", name == "_666" ~ "Other", name == "_999" ~ "Don't know" ) ) %>% dplyr::filter(!is.na(method)) %>% select(-name) Code path <- file.path( "Data",
